description: This course combines theory and practice of digital accessibility by highlighting concepts and standards of accessibility, the importance of conducting usability tests guided by technical criteria (such as the WCAG guidelines), qualitative and inclusive research methods, and using specific tools to evaluate accessibility.
prerequisites: Experience in User Experience and basic Acessibility fundamentals
title: Acessibilidade em UX Design: Dos Fundamentos à Prática (Accessibility in UX Design: From Fundamentals to Practice)
topics: Fundamentals of Digital Accessibility
Introduction to the WCAG Guidelines (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines)
Introduction to disabilities: visual, hearing, motor, intellectual and multiple.
Persona analysis with a focus on accessibility
WCAG 2.1/2.2: structure and principles
National and international laws (Brazilian Inclusion Law, ADA, Section 508, European Accessibility Act).
Evaluating websites with a checklist based on WCAG
Accessibility analysis with tools such as WAVE, Axe and Lighthouse
Visual Design and Cognitive Accessibility
Typography, colors and contrast
Responsive layouts and visual hierarchy
Accessibility for dyslexia, ADHD and autism
Screen Reading and Keyboard Navigation Tools
ARIA roles and HTML semantics for accessibility
Research with Users with Disabilities
Figma and accessible prototyping
How to represent accessibility in wireframes and flows
Validation with automated tools and real tests
Accessibility Culture and Implementation in Teams
Documentation, communication and advocacy
Strategies for building more inclusive teams
